grammar.description: Introduction to basic sentence structure and capitalization
learningObjectives: Understand that sentences begin with capital letters
Learn that sentences end with punctuation

rules.description: The first letter of a sentence must be capitalized
practice: the dog runs fast → The dog runs fast.
i am happy → I am happy.
she reads books → She reads books.

rules.description: Sentences end with a period (.), question mark (?), or exclamation mark (!)
practice: The bird sings → The bird sings.
Where is my book → Where is my book?
I love this game → I love this game!

rules.description: A simple sentence has a subject (who/what) and a verb (action)
practice: Identify the subject and verb in: The dog barks.
Identify the subject and verb in: I eat lunch.
Identify the subject and verb in: Flowers grow.

activities.description: Fix sentences with capitalization and punctuation errors
activities.instructions: Students correct sentences by adding proper capitalization and punctuation

activities.description: Build simple sentences using given words
activities.instructions: Students combine words to create proper sentences

activities.description: Identify subjects and verbs in simple sentences
activities.instructions: Students underline subjects and circle verbs in sentences

assessment.description: Students should be able to write simple sentences with proper capitalization and punctuation
criteria: Can capitalize the first letter of sentences
Can identify subjects and verbs in simple sentences
